Anyone that wants Bitcoin to survive long term, should be against solutions such as Lightning that take transaction fees away from miners. Block rewards will keep halving, and transaction fees were ment to replace block rewards. Fewer rewards = fewer hashpower = less security.

BTC has a great robust P2P network. A real cost is paid for all messages. Without a weight limit, without cost, it’d be possible to spam the network  Currently Lightning’s graph has no such cost structure. To stop spam we’ll need to think about relating costs to channel updates.
